title: 1968 CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament
text:
The 1968 CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament was the second edition of the <a href="CONCACAF%20Men%27s%20Olympic%20Qualifying%20Championship">CONCACAF Pre-Olympic Tournament</a>, the quadrennial, international <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organised by the <a href="CONCACAF">CONCACAF</a> to determine which national teams from the North, Central America and Caribbean region qualify for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%20Summer%20Olympics">Olympic football tournament</a>. 
<a href="Mexico%20Olympic%20football%20team">Mexico</a>, as host nation, qualified directly for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics</a> together with final round winners, <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a> and <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a> as CONCACAF representatives.
Qualification.
Qualified teams.
The following teams qualified for the final tournament.
Final round.
<a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a> won 4–1 on aggregate and qualified for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics</a>.
<a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala</a> advance via a drawing of lots after a 3–3 aggregate and qualified for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics</a>.
Qualified teams for Summer Olympics.
The following three teams from CONCACAF qualified for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics</a>, including Mexico which qualified as hosts.
